roleset.name: clinical classification of how much residual tumor exists after a resection

example.name: unusual headword
example.text: pT3b , N0 , MX , R0 adenocarcinoma of the prostate
example.amr: (d / disease-disorder :name (n / name :op1 "adenocarcinoma") :location (a / anatomical-site :name (n2 / name :op1 "prostate")) :mod (r / residual-tumor-91 :ARG2 "R0") :ARG1-of (a2 / ajcc-entity-91 :ARG3 (t / tumor-stage-entity :value "pT3b") :ARG4 (l / lymph-stage-entity :value "N0") :ARG5 (m / mets-stage-entity :value "MX")))

roleset.note: NOTES: Added for THYME-AMR. Could expand ARG1 definition to subsume "adenocarcinoma" in "R0 adenocarcinoma" example, but this appears to be an unusual usage â€“ the residual-tumor values nearly always modify a surgery term.
